name: Ser Richard Horpe
text: Renown. Ser Richard Horpe gets +1 STR for each power he has. Action: Move 1 power from a card you control to another card in play. (Limit once per round.)
label: Ser Richard Horpe

name: Sellsails
text: Bestow (2). Action: Discard 1 gold from Sellsails to choose and stand a Smuggler or Warship card. (Limit once per phase.)
flavor: The striped hulls of Lysene war galleys had been seen offshore, and Varys had reports from Myr of sellsail captains taking service with Dragonstone.
label: Sellsails

name: Dark and Full of Terrors
text: Play only if you control a R'hllor character. Action: Choose a kneeling character with STR 3 or lower and place it in shadows with a shadow token on it. While that card is in shadows, it gains shadow (X). X is its printed cost.
flavor: For the night is dark and full of terrors.
label: Dark and Full of Terrors

name: No Song So Sweet
text: Action: During a [power] challenge, choose a standing [baratheon] character you control and have it participate in the challenge on your side. Reaction: After you play a Song event, pay 1 gold to return No Song So Sweet from your discard pile to your hand.
label: No Song So Sweet

name: Set Down Our Deeds
text: Action: Kneel your faction card to discard up to 3 power from a card you own. Draw 2 cards for each power discarded this way.
flavor: Ser Cortnay Penrose wore no armor. He sat a sorrel stallion, his standard-bearer a dapple grey. Above them flapped Baratheon's crowned stag and the crossed quills of Penrose, white on a russet field.
label: Set Down Our Deeds

name: Black Lorren
text: Bestow (1). Reaction: After you win a challenge in which Black Lorren is attacking, discard 1 gold from an attacking Raider character to choose and kill a defending character.
flavor: "The singers call Andrik best now. And Black Lorren and Qarl the Maid are near as dread." <cite>Dagmer Cleftjaw</cite>
label: Black Lorren

name: Sea Song
text: While you control The Reader, he gains insight. Reaction: After 1 or more cards are discarded for reserve, either: draw 1 card, or gain 1 power for your faction. (Limit twice per round.)
label: Sea Song

name: Saltcliffe
text: Action: Kneel Saltcliffe to move 1 gold from the treasury or a card in play to a Raider character without gold.
flavor: The islands are stern and stony places, scant of comfort and bleak of prospect. Death is never far here, and life is mean and meager.
label: Saltcliffe

name: Though All Men Do Despise Us
text: Reaction: After no defenders are declared, each attacking Raider character gains 1 power. (Max 1 per challenge.)
flavor: The Codds were not well regarded in the Iron Islands; the men were said to be thieves and cowards, the women wantons who bedded with their own fathers and brothers.
label: Though All Men Do Despise Us

name: No Godless Man
text: Reaction: After you win a [power] challenge in which you control a participating Drowned God character, for every 5 STR by which you won the challenge, draw 1 card and discard 1 card at random from the losing opponent’s hand. (Max 1 per challenge.)
flavor: "No godless man may sit the Seastone Chair." <cite>Aeron Damphair</cite>
label: No Godless Man

name: Ser Lancel Lannister
text: Power on Lord or Lady characters does not count towards their controllers' power total. Action: Kneel Ser Lancel Lannister to put Warrior's Sons into play from your hand or discard pile.
flavor: "On the morrow I will return to King's Landing and swear my sword to the new High Septon and the Seven. I mean to take vows and join the Warrior's Sons."
label: Ser Lancel Lannister (HMW)

name: Bronn
text: Bestow (3). No attachments except Weapon. Bronn gets +2 STR for each gold he has. Interrupt: When a Lord or Lady character would be killed, discard each gold (cannot be 0) from Bronn to save it. Then, if that character was Tyrion Lannister, you may return Bronn to your hand.
label: Bronn (HMW)

name: Mountain's Man
text: [lannister] character only. Attached character gains the House Clegane trait. Reaction: After attached character discards a card using pillage, choose and kneel a card with lower printed cost than that card's.
flavor: "Unleash Ser Gregor and send him before us with his reavers. Tell them I want to see the riverlands afire from the Gods Eye to the Red Fork." <cite>Tywin Lannister</cite>
label: Mountain's Man

name: "A Lion Still Has Claws"
text: Reduce the cost to play "A Lion Still Has Claws" by 1 for each Scheme plot card revealed. Reaction: After you win an [intrigue] challenge by 5 or more STR, choose a Trait. Return each character with that Trait and printed cost X or lower to its owner’s hand.
flavor: "In a coat of gold or a coat of red, a lion still has claws. And mine are long and sharp, my lord, as long and sharp as yours." <cite>The Rains of Castamere</cite>
label: "A Lion Still Has Claws"

name: Burning Bright
text: Action: Put an Army or Knight character into play from your discard pile. At the end of the phase, if that card is still in play, discard it from play (cannot be saved).
flavor: Ser Addam Marbrand had the command. Tyrion saw his banner unfurl as his standard-bearer shook it out; a burning tree, orange and smoke.
label: Burning Bright

name: Anders Yronwood
text: Intimidate. While you are not the first player, each House Yronwood character you control does not kneel when declared as an attacker in the first challenge you initiate each phase.
flavor: The most powerful of the Dornish lords was Anders Yronwood, the Bloodroyal, Lord of Yronwood and Warden of the Stone Way.
label: Anders Yronwood

name: Edric Dayne
text: Reaction: After a non-loyal card enters your discard pile, place it in shadows (without that card gaining the shadow keyword.). (Limit once per round.)
label: Edric Dayne (HMW)

name: Sword of the Morning
text: Unique [martell] character or House Dayne character only. While attached character is attacking, it gets +1 STR for each defending character. Reaction: After attached character is declared as an attacker, choose up to 3 characters controlled by the defending player. Each of those characters must be declared as a defender for this challenge, if able.
label: Sword of the Morning

name: Elia's Lance
text: Sand Snake character only. Ambush (2). If attached character is Elia Sand, she gains stealth. Reaction: After you lose a challenge in which attached character is attacking, the winning opponent must choose and return a defending character to its owner’s hand.
label: Elia's Lance

name: We Guard the Way
text: Action: Choose X characters with the Guard or House Yronwood trait. Until the end of the phase, each chosen character gains renown and does not kneel when declared as a defender.
label: We Guard the Way

name: Old Tattersalt
text: Shadow (2). Reaction: After Old Tattersalt enters play, search the top X cards of your deck for a card with printed cost 1 or lower, reveal it, and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck. X is your reserve value. Action: Kneel Blackbird to return Old Tattersalt to shadows.
label: Old Tattersalt

name: First Ranger
text: Unique character only. Attached character gains a [military] icon and the Ranger trait. Reaction: After you win a [military] challenge in which you control a participating Ranger character, choose and kill a non-unique character with STR X or lower controlled by the losing opponent. X is the number of Ranger characters you control. (Limit once per phase.)
label: First Ranger

name: Lord Steward
text: Unique character only. Attached character gains an [intrigue] icon and the Steward trait. Reaction: After you win an [intrigue] challenge in which you control a participating Steward character, choose a character with printed cost X or lower controlled by the losing opponent. Take control of it until the end of the phase. X is the number of Steward characters you control. (Limit once per phase.)
label: Lord Steward

name: I Pledge My Life and Honor
text: Reaction: After you win a challenge as the defending player, search the top 10 cards of your deck for a [thenightswatch] character and put it into play. Shuffle your deck. Then, sacrifice a character that shares a Trait with that character.
flavor: ...to the Night's Watch, for this night and all the nights to come.
label: I Pledge My Life and Honor

name: Corn, Corn, Corn
text: Interrupt: When the challenges phase ends, kneel a Steward or Raven card to choose an opponent who does not support you and a challenge type that has not been initiated against you this phase. That player must satisfy the claim of that challenge type as if you were the winning opponent. (Max 1 per phase.)
label: Corn, Corn, Corn

name: Farlen
text: Each unique Direwolf character you control gains renown. Reaction: After you marshal Farlen, search your hand, deck, and discard pile for The Wolfswood and put it into play. Shuffle your deck.
label: Farlen

name: Reek
text: Shadow (2). If you control Theon Greyjoy, sacrifice Reek. Reaction: After you win an unopposed challenge in which you control an attacking House Bolton character, give control of Reek to the losing opponent. Then, choose a non-loyal character controlled by that player and take control of it.
label: Reek (HMW)

name: Our Blades are Sharp
text: While you control Harrenhal or The Dreadfort, reduce the cost to play Our Blades Are Sharp by 1. Action: Sacrifice a non-[stark] card to return up to 2 House Bolton cards from your discard and/or dead pile to your hand.
label: Our Blades are Sharp

name: Family, Duty, Honor
text: Interrupt: When a House Tully character you control would leave play, discard 1 power from that character to save it.
flavor: "There was a time when Cat was all I wanted in this world.... but she was a daughter of Riverrun, and Hoster Tully. Family, Duty, Honor, Sansa. Family, Duty, Honor meant I could never have her hand." <cite>Littlefinger</cite>
label: Family, Duty, Honor

name: Here We Stand
text: Play only if you control a standing House Mormont character. Dominance Action: Search the top 10 cards of your deck for any number of Bear Island, Bearskin Cloak, and House Mormont cards, reveal them, and add them to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
label: Here We Stand

name: Golden Company
text: Bestow (1). While Golden Company has 1 or more gold, it gains renown. Interrupt: When a Mercenary character would be returned to your hand, discard 1 gold from Golden Company to save that character.
label: Golden Company

name: Septa Lemore
text: While you control Aegon Targaryen, he gains insight. Interrupt: When Septa Lemore leaves play, choose a [targaryen] character you control with shadow. Return that character to shadows.
label: Septa Lemore

name: Our Word Is Good as Gold
text: Action: Search the top 10 cards of your deck for a Mercenary character and put it into play. Shuffle your deck. At the end of the phase, if that card is still in play, return it to your hand.
flavor: Our word is good as gold has been their boast since the days of Bittersteel.
label: Our Word Is Good as Gold

name: The Dragon Has Three Heads
text: Action: Until the end of the phase, each Dragon character you control gains: - intimidate, if you control Drogon. - renown, if you control Rhaegal. - stealth, if you control Viserion.
label: The Dragon Has Three Heads

name: Beneath the Gold, the Bitter Steel
text: Challenges Action: Choose a Mercenary character with 1 or more gold. Until the end of the phase, it gains renown and no attachments except Item. If it has 3 or more gold, it gains insight and intimidate until the end of the phase.
label: Beneath the Gold, the Bitter Steel

name: Mina Redwyne
text: Reaction: After The Queen of Thorns or a House Redwyne card enters play under your control or your discard pile, draw 1 card. (Limit once per phase.)
label: Mina Redwyne

name: Ser Guyard Morrigen
text: Bestow (1). Each Rainbow Guard character you control with 1 or more gold gains an [intrigue] icon. Reaction: After a Summer plot card is revealed, place 1 gold from the treasury on, either: a Knight character, or each Rainbow Guard character you control. (Limit once per phase.)
label: Ser Guyard Morrigen

name: Behold our Bounty
text: Reaction: After you win a challenge, return an attacking Small Council or Spy character to your hand to raise the claim value on your revealed plot card by 1 until the end of the challenge.
label: Behold our Bounty

name: First in Battle
text: Play only if you control 3 or more The Reach locations. Challenges Action: Each Army or House Tarly character you control does not kneel when declared as an attacker in the first challenge you initiate this phase.
label: First in Battle

name: We Light the Way
text: Action: Kneel a House Hightower or Oldtown card to place the top card of your deck in shadows with a shadow token on it. While that card is in shadows, it gains shadow (X). X is its printed cost.
flavor: And beyond, where the Honeywine widened into Whispering Sound, rose the Hightower, its beacon fires bright against the dawn.
label: We Light the Way

name: Lady Stoneheart
text: Intimidate. Forced Interrupt: When the challenges phase ends, each player must choose and kill a loyal or House Frey character they control, if able. Dominance Action: Discard 1 kiss token from a character or 1 power from a Brotherhood character to put Lady Stoneheart into play from your dead pile.
label: Lady Stoneheart

name: Brave Companions
text: Bestow (1). Pillage. Brave Companions get +1 STR for each character you control with 1 or more gold. Reaction: After you marshal Brave Companions, search the top 10 cards of your deck for an Army character, a Commander character, and a Mercenary character, reveal them, and add them to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
label: Brave Companions

name: Septon Utt
text:
Bestow (2).
Each unique character you control with 2 or more gold gains insight.
flavor: "I pray to the Warrior for strength, but the gods made me weak."
label: Septon Utt

name: Kindly Man
text: Ambush (4). Shadow (2). Reaction: After Kindly Man stands, choose an agenda or a card in play and, either: place a non-gold, non-power token of your choice on that card; or discard a non-gold, non-power token from that card. (Limit 3 times per round.)
label: Kindly Man

name: Shagwell
text: Bestow (1). While a character with 1 or more gold has a keyword, each Fool character with 1 or more gold gains that keyword.
flavor: "You mustn't hurt sweet Shagwell, I'm too droll to die."
label: Shagwell

name: Jinglebell
text: Interrupt: When Jinglebell is killed, search your deck for a card that shares a Trait with him, reveal it, and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
flavor: "A son for a son, heh. But that’s a grandson… and he never was much use." <cite>Walder Frey</cite>
label: Jinglebell

name: Sweetsleep
text: Terminal. Treat the printed text box of each other attachment attached to the attached card as if it were blank (except for Traits).
label: Sweetsleep

name: The Higher Mysteries
text: Reaction: After you win a challenge in which you control a participating Maester character, reveal the top card of your deck and put it into play.
flavor: "I have studied what the Citadel calls the higher mysteries—magic, for want of a better word. A fascinating pursuit, but of small use, which is why so few maesters trouble themselves with it." <cite>Maester Luwin</cite>
label: The Higher Mysteries

name: As High as Honor
text: Marshaling Action: Kneel a neutral location with printed cost 1 or higher to put a neutral card into play from your hand knelt. Then, if that card has the House Arryn trait, stand it.
flavor: The Arryns were proud, and prickly of their honor.
label: As High as Honor

name: We Stand Together
text: Reaction: After you win a challenge, choose and stand an attacking House Frey character. (Stand each attacking House Frey character instead if it was the third challenge you initiated this phase.)
label: We Stand Together

name: A Mummer's Farce
text: Your deck may include non-loyal Fool characters from any faction. You may marshal or play facedown cards you control attached to a Fool character as if they were in your hand. Forced Reaction: After a Fool character you control stands, attach the top card of your deck facedown to it, as a Weapon attachment with the text: "Terminal. Attached character gets +1 STR."
label: A Mummer's Farce

name: The Many-Faced God
text: Your plot deck cannot include Kingdom plot cards. Reduce the cost of the first card you ambush each round by 1. Action: Kneel your faction card to choose a character and a player. Until the end of the phase, that character gains each of the printed challenge icons, keywords, faction affiliations, and Traits of the top character in that player's dead pile.
label: The Many-Faced God

name: The Crone
text: Each character with printed STR 1 or lower cannot leave play.
label: The Crone

name: The Father
text: Forced Interrupt: When the dominance phase ends, choose a unique non-Army character controlled by each player. Then, return each of those characters to its owner's hand.
label: The Father

name: The Late Lord Frey
text: Reaction: After you initiate a challenge, put a House Frey card into play from your hand or discard pile.
label: The Late Lord Frey

name: The Maiden
text: While The Maiden is in your used pile, increase the initiative value on your revealed plot card by 2, and the reserve value on your revealed The Seven plot card by 2.
label: The Maiden

name: The Mother
text: Reaction: After a character enters play under an opponent's control, if another character entered play under that player's control this round, draw 1 card. (Limit twice per round.)
label: The Mother

name: The Smith
text: Marshaling Action: Kneel an attachment to choose and kneel a location.
label: The Smith

name: The Stranger
text: When Revealed: Each player chooses a character controlled by an opponent. Then, kill each character with the same printed cost as the chosen characters.
label: The Stranger

name: The Warrior
text: During a challenge in which you control an attacking The Seven character, raise the claim value on The Warrior by 1.
label: The Warrior
